channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ukraine: Peace Disrupted By Barrage; Russia Sends New Aid Convoy
item.description: Rocket fire tested — but didn't break — a week-old cease-fire between Ukraine and pro-Russian separatists Friday night. And the EU made concessions to Russia on a trade pact.
item.content:encoded:
Rocket fire tested — but didn't break — a week-old cease-fire between Ukraine and pro-Russian separatists Friday night. And the EU made concessions to Russia on a trade pact.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Former Ambassador: It's Not Too Late To Arm Syrian Rebels
item.description: Former Ambassador Fred Hof tells NPR's Wade Goodwyn that air power is not enough to defeat the Islamic State. A ground component, even if it is not American, is needed for long-term success, he says.
item.content:encoded:
Former Ambassador Fred Hof tells NPR's Wade Goodwyn that air power is not enough to defeat the Islamic State. A ground component, even if it is not American, is needed for long-term success, he says.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Israeli, Palestinian Parents Share Their Painful Stories Of Loss
item.description: The Parents Circle is a group of Israeli and Palestinian mothers and fathers who have lost children in the conflict. Two of them visited NPR and said this summer's war has only made conditions worse.
item.content:encoded:
The Parents Circle is a group of Israeli and Palestinian mothers and fathers who have lost children in the conflict. Two of them visited NPR and said this summer's war has only made conditions worse.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: What The U.S. Has Given To Fight Ebola (And Why It's Not Enough)
item.description: U.S. aid is beginning to flow into the countries fighting the deadly virus. But while protective equipment and food supplies are vital, what's really needed now are health workers.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. aid is beginning to flow into the countries fighting the deadly virus. But while protective equipment and food supplies are vital, what's really needed now are health workers.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Free Syrian Army Struggles To Maintain Control In Two-Front War
item.description: Robert Siegel speaks with Noah Bonsey, senior Syria analyst for the International Crisis Group, about the state of the Free Syrian Army.
item.content:encoded:
Robert Siegel speaks with Noah Bonsey, senior Syria analyst for the International Crisis Group, about the state of the Free Syrian Army.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Border Crossings Slow But Immigration Courts Still Face Backlog
item.description: Judge Dana Leigh Marks, president of the National Association of Immigration Judges, talks to Robert Siegel about how the flood of young migrants has changed the way courts prioritize immigration cases.
item.content:encoded:
Judge Dana Leigh Marks, president of the National Association of Immigration Judges, talks to Robert Siegel about how the flood of young migrants has changed the way courts prioritize immigration cases.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Ian Paisley Was 'Powerful In The Pulpit' And On Political Platforms
item.description: In Northern Ireland, preacher and politician Ian Paisley died on Friday. Robert Siegel speaks with Paisley's biographer, Ed Moloney, about his legacy.
item.content:encoded:
In Northern Ireland, preacher and politician Ian Paisley died on Friday. Robert Siegel speaks with Paisley's biographer, Ed Moloney, about his legacy.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Toronto Mayor Rob Ford Withdraws Re-Election Bid
item.description: He says he is seeking treatment for a tumor in his abdomen. His brother Doug Ford will run in his place. Earlier this year, Rob Ford took time off from his job to seek help for substance abuse.
item.content:encoded:
He says he is seeking treatment for a tumor in his abdomen. His brother Doug Ford will run in his place. Earlier this year, Rob Ford took time off from his job to seek help for substance abuse.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Krishnadev Calamur

item.title: Riding The 'Silver Dragon,' Surfers Tame China's 10-Foot River Waves
item.description: The Qiantang Tidal Bore, a big river wave that forms during China's Mid-Autumn Festival, barrels upstream for miles through the crowded city of Hangzhou.
item.content:encoded:
The Qiantang Tidal Bore, a big river wave that forms during China's Mid-Autumn Festival, barrels upstream for miles through the crowded city of Hangzhou.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: 10 Arrested In Pakistan Over 2012 Attack On Malala Yousafzai
item.description: The army says the men were ordered by the Pakistani Taliban to kill the teenager who has stood against extremist attempts to prevent girls from attending school.
item.content:encoded:
The army says the men were ordered by the Pakistani Taliban to kill the teenager who has stood against extremist attempts to prevent girls from attending school.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: How Do You Catch Ebola: By Air, Sweat Or Water?
item.description: Americans have many questions — and misconceptions — about the deadly virus that's rapidly spreading in West Africa. We asked two scientists to explain more about how Ebola is transmitted.
item.content:encoded:
Americans have many questions — and misconceptions — about the deadly virus that's rapidly spreading in West Africa. We asked two scientists to explain more about how Ebola is transmitted.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Linda Poon

item.title: Cleared Of Murder, Pistorius Found Guilty Of Culpable Homicide
item.description: South African Paralympic champion Oscar Pistorius has been found guilty of culpable homicide for the killing of his girlfriend. On Thursday, he was cleared of premeditated murder.
item.content:encoded:
South African Paralympic champion Oscar Pistorius has been found guilty of culpable homicide for the killing of his girlfriend. On Thursday, he was cleared of premeditated murder.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Ofeibea Quist-Arcton

item.title: Mexican Crackdown Slows Central American Immigration To U.S.
item.description: Under pressure from the United States, Mexico has begun arresting and deporting tens of thousands of Central Americans long before they reach the U.S. border.
item.content:encoded:
Under pressure from the United States, Mexico has begun arresting and deporting tens of thousands of Central Americans long before they reach the U.S. border.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Make Way For Ambulances: They're Stuck In Bangalore Traffic
item.description: The Indian city is a busy high-tech hub with crowded roads. Ambulances get tied up in traffic along with everyone else. Clever thinkers are coming up with solutions. Motorcycle ambulance, anyone?
item.content:encoded:
The Indian city is a busy high-tech hub with crowded roads. Ambulances get tied up in traffic along with everyone else. Clever thinkers are coming up with solutions. Motorcycle ambulance, anyone?

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Maanvi Singh

item.title: Northern Ireland Unionist Hard-Liner Ian Paisley Dies At 88
item.description: The Protestant cleric who bitterly opposed the IRA later forged an unlikely friendship with senior Sinn Fein leader Martin McGuinness.
item.content:encoded:
The Protestant cleric who bitterly opposed the IRA later forged an unlikely friendship with senior Sinn Fein leader Martin McGuinness.

item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
